radiographic_examinations.findings: The first and follow-up MRI of the thighs demonstrated the relative preservation of the quadriceps muscle.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The relative preservation of the quadriceps muscle persisted even 8 years later.

radiographic_examinations.findings: The original quadriceps muscle biopsy performed in 1994 was mildly abnormal; a repeated muscle biopsy performed 8 years later demonstrates vacuolization and marked myopathic features.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The biopsy findings progressed from mild abnormalities to prominent vacuoles and myopathic features.
